contentrichtext.text: [[File:Map.Konan-Town.Kagawa.PNG|thumb|Kōnan in Kagawa Prefecture]] {{Nihongo|'''Kōnan'''|香南町|Kōnan-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Kagawa District, Kagawa|Kagawa District]], [[Kagawa Prefecture|Kagawa]], [[Japan]]. On January 10, 2006 Kōnan, along with the towns of [[Aji, Kagawa|Aji]] and [[Mure, Kagawa|Mure]], both from [[Kita District, Kagawa|Kita District]], the town of [[Kagawa, Kagawa|Kagawa]], also from [[Kagawa District, Kagawa|Kagawa District]], and the town of [[Kokubunji, Kagawa|Kokubunji]], from [[Ayauta District, Kagawa|Ayauta District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Takamatsu, Kagawa|Takamatsu]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipalities of Japan|municipality]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated population of 7,938 and a [[population density|density]] of 539.27 persons per km². The total area was 14.72 km². ==External links== * [http://www.city.takamatsu.kagawa.jp/ Official website of Takamatsu] {{ja icon}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Konan, Kagawa}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Kagawa Prefecture]] {{Kagawa-geo-stub}}
